Fidelity House CRC is a nonprofit organization committed to supporting people with developmental disabilities and their families. We are proud to offer 26 community residences throughout Lawrence, Methuen, Haverhill, Georgetown, Salisbury, Amesbury and Andover along with specialized services across 70 cities and towns in Northeastern Massachusetts. 

Our goal is to help children, teens and adults with disabilities such as Autism and Down Syndrome to achieve the richest and fullest lives possible. Over the years, our direct service professionals, nurses, case managers, and administrators have developed a culture of care and compassion. We are actively seeking job candidates who are committed to our mission. 

Ready to fall in love with meaningful work? We're hiring Skills Instructors (direct care staff) for Andover, Haverhill, Lawrence, Georgetown, Amesbury, Salisbury, and Methuen with many schedules to choose from. Go to work in a home for 4-5 people in a regular neighborhood, wearing your own clothes -- not a medical environment. Full or part time positions assisting with life skills, assisting with meals, personal care, medical appointments and leisure activities. 


ACTIVITIES:

Complete required forms on medical, behavioral and community goals from their Individual Support Plan (ISP) and help individuals in their day-to-day life to achieve their goals such as:

Assisting each individual in developing skills in all areas of community living, including doing household tasks and learning social skills.
Assisting each individual to behave appropriately.
Assisting each individual to be active in their community.
Assist and provide safety and personal care to individuals.
Give out medicine to individuals, as needed.
Communicate with other staff through reports and logs.
Help individuals with community and recreational activities.
Attend mandatory training 

Attend, as specified by the Program Director, specific training in the management of orthotic devices, adaptive equipment, safe transfers/body mechanics, as needed, to serve individual residents.
Help and teach money management including simple budgeting and transactions.
Depending on their skills, work with individuals to meal plan and prepare daily healthy meals and snacks.  Remember to consider any special diets prescribed by their doctor. 

The Skills Instructor will
Teach table setting, good table manners and cleaning up as appropriate; and
Teach and help with food shopping and daily errands. 
Provide constant supervision with other staff.
Comply with all applicable statutes, ordinances, policies, regulations and guidelines of Fidelity House and our contracting agency.
Other duties as assigned by Program Director.

Essential Physical Requirements:
The ability to move independently throughout a wide range of environments, some of which may not be wheelchair or otherwise handicapped accessible, is required. Independent transportation to locations that may not be served by public transportation may be necessary. Fidelity House Human Services will make reasonable accommodations, whenever possible, when needed and/or requested by employees. Requests for accommodations will be honored, unless the accommodation would cause undue hardship on the operation of the program and/or on the organization.

SHIFT	Many shifts and locations available, both part time and full time. Please visit our website at Fidelityhhs.org to view all of our opportunities. 

TO APPLY: Please visit our website to apply online. www.fidelityhhs.org/careers.  You may also visit our office from 9am to 4pm to fill out an application in person. 439 S. Union Street, Suite 401 Lawrence, MA

Fidelity House CRC (Agency) is a non-profit organization committed to supporting people with developmental disabilities and their families.  Please view our website at www.fidelityhhs.org

The Employment Specialist will provide training, supervision, job coaching, supports, travel training and transportation to persons served for community based employment, volunteer activities, and other community based activities related to employment (i.e. job tours, job shadowing, training opportunities, offsite assessments, etc.). The position will contribute to the development and implementation of the ISP and career plan goals and objectives for persons served. The Employment Specialist must be committed to building positive relationships with the people that he/she is supporting as well as with those people and organizations that he/she comes into contact with in the community.


SCHEDULE FOR THIS POSITION: Monday-Friday 8am-4pm (40 Hours Per Week)

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Provide supervision, assessment, training, coaching, and teaching to persons served in the Employment Department for the purpose of obtaining and maintaining jobs in the community. 

Assist in the implementation of community-based activities (volunteer, paid work, etc.) that promote choice, inclusion, dignity, and respect, while enhancing skill development. 

Ensure activities and supports provided are based on goals, objectives, and support strategies outlined in support/career plans of persons served. Work a flexible schedule (including evenings and weekends) as defined by supervisor to support people served in the hours required of their employers.

Ensure timely arrival and departure at community jobs, assessments, volunteer shifts, and other activities (job tours, job shadowing, etc.) by providing transportation and/or support to use public/private transportation. 

Ensure accurate completion of job, volunteer, or assessment tasks while in the community. Provide timely and consistent feedback on performance, satisfaction and progress of persons served to Case Managers, Manager, Director, and other staff members through documentation, phone/email communication, and attendance at vocational team meetings, case conferences, support plan meetings, etc. as needed.

Work with employer and/or community member in a positive and professional manner to help persons served establish support from the employer and co-workers. Provide training to employers when applicable and work to increase natural supports and decrease level and intensity of supports offered by Fidelity House CRC. 

Assist the employer to complete job performance evaluations with persons served. Provide accurate and complete information regarding number of hours worked, hourly pay, and other information needed for employment data collection and/or payroll. Inform the Case Manager, Manager and Director of all concerns expressed by employer or individuals served in a timely manner.

Provide personal care, assistance, and support to individuals consistent with their medical, physical, and psychological needs in a respectful manner. Know and understand the profiles and histories of individuals supported, as well as strategies to promote a positive learning/working environment for each person. Communicate with Case Manager, Manager, and Director any issues pertinent to the health, safety, and well-being of the people served. Understand/implement crisis plans, behavior treatment plans, and medical protocols correctly and consistently.

Complete all documentation required by Fidelity House CRC and regulatory agencies, focusing on providing complete, relevant, and accurate information in a timely manner. Complete incident, accident/injury, and restraint reports; job coaching summary documentation, data sheets, etc. in a manner which clearly identifies all components of the intervention and in accordance with regulatory expectations. Participate in the implementation of support plan goals, objectives, and tracking of information related to those, as well as all services and activities provided by Fidelity House CRC.

Perform all duties in a manner which demonstrates an awareness and respect of each individual's legal, civic and human rights. Maintain and enforce the confidentiality of any information relating to individuals served.

Maintain customer focus at all times in the delivery of services. Provide quality services, be responsive to customer needs, and display professionalism in relationships with referral sources, persons served, and family members/guardians.

Report injuries of persons served or self immediately to supervisor and complete follow-up paperwork when needed. Ensure compliance with DDS and DPH regulations, able to file HCSIS reports and follow DPPC and CRC policies and procedures.

Communicate with Director of Day Services and Manager any medical issues pertinent to the health and safety of the people served.

Work collaboratively with team members, actively participating in goal development, meetings, and maintenance of program areas/spaces. Work as a positive team member, supporting other staff during interventions, activities, and other duties as assigned by supervisor.

Complete all mandatory trainings to ensure skill maintenance and development. This includes CPR, First Aid, and other trainings mandated by CRC, as well as other department and state agency required trainings and certifications. Complete supplementary trainings related to functions within the Case Manager role, as well as new initiatives identified by CRC or state agencies.

Assist in maintaining a clean and safe environment by reporting issues to the proper personnel.
Perform any and all other duties as assigned by supervisor, and report to same when unable to complete specified duties.

Job Requirements:
High School Diploma, GED or Associates Degree in Human Services or related field
0-3 years of experience in the human services field
Desire and passion for serving people with disabilities
Preferred one year experience working with individuals with DD, MH or BI
Commensurate experience may be substituted for educational requirements
Must have a valid driver's license.

For consideration: Please forward your resume, or apply directly to our career portal at www.fidelityhhs.org/careers.

Product Support Associate
Location: Boston, MA
Position is available: Immediately
 
THE OPPORTUNITY
The Support & Operations Team sets up and supports internal staff, school leaders, teachers, and districts to fully leverage ANet's products and services and to ensure our partners have access to high quality resources that drive strong instructional practice. The Product Support Associate will build their expertise of ANet's products and their application in a variety of contexts and apply this knowledge to provide best-in-class support by phone, email, and through pre-made resources to support logistical and technical questions from our school partners. In addition to providing direct support to partners, Product Support Associates ensure the best possible products by executing functional testing.  This is a great opportunity for someone looking to build their skills in customer service, product support, and/or quality assurance. The Product Support Associate will work closely with members of our Quality Assurance, Support, and regional teams. 
 
WHAT YOU'LL DO
 
Ensure our school partners have a strong back-to-school and in-year experience by providing in-the-moment support
Be an expert in our online platforms and provide strong communication to support school partners via phone and email
Troubleshoot issues that arise including identifying causes and resolutions or alternative paths for leveraging products
Accurately gather and document information about issues and questions that partners are raising
Understand the unique needs of partners and adjust support and recommendations as needed
Escalate technical issues and challenges to Tier 2 and Engineering when necessary
 
 
Ensures the reliability of our products for our partners by supporting functional testing
Tests software programs; compare specifications to documentation, identifies, analyzes and documents defects, questionable functions, and errors 
Contributes to establishment of standards and procedures for testing 
Recommends product improvements or revisions to Product Managers and Engineering team
Conducts compatibility tests with other software programs, hardware, multiple operating systems, and network environments as needed
 
WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING
In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:
You bring prior experience in an education setting and can apply that knowledge to provide support that demonstrates empathy for our school partners.
You are motivated by helping leaders and teachers be effective in their roles. You go above and beyond to make sure our products enhance a student's learning experience.
You are a great listener and love a challenging puzzle. You apply these skills to get at the root of a partners needs. 
You are a masterful communicator, and can translate complex technical information so it is accessible to anyone.
You sweat the small stuff and bring exceptional attention to detail, prioritization, and strong organizational skills.
You are energized by working in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, highly collaborative, and team-oriented environment.
You understand that schools are dynamic places and are comfortable working on projects and tasks with shifting priorities.
 
 
HOW TO APPLY
We are now accepting applications for this position, which will be reviewed on a rolling basis. To apply, please click on the blue “Apply” button. You will then be prompted to complete a brief application and upload a resume and thoughtful cover letter in which you outline why you are interested in working for ANet and how your skills and experience meet the qualifications of the position.

JVS is a non-profit, non-sectarian agency.  Our mission is to empower individuals from diverse communities to find employment and build careers, and to partner with employers to hire, develop and retain productive workforces. 

	JVS provides a broad range of services including adult education, skills training, job readiness training, job placement and support, and access to post-secondary education.  JVS assists employers in their search for well-qualified job applicants and their initiatives to upgrade the skills of their incumbent workforce.  

POSITION SUMMARY:    
Under the direction of the Lead Career Coach of CareerPath Now (CPN) and in collaboration with the CPN team, the Career Coach creates individualized plans that place Department of Transitional Assistance (DTA) clients on a path to self-sufficiency and that ensure work-required SNAP and TAFDC recipients are able to meet work requirements to maintain their benefits. Through 1:1 career coaching and small group workshops, the coach supports clients from diverse backgrounds, many of whom face one or more significant barriers to employment, in their efforts to connect with education, job training and employment with an end goal of financial independence.  Successful candidates must have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, experience working with clients from diverse backgrounds facing multiple barriers, strong time management capabilities, a proven ability to teach job search and application skills, an attention to detail, and outstanding record keeping skills, in addition to a strong commitment to the program mission and goals. This position is located at 75 Federal Street, Boston, MA and may involve some travel into local neighborhoods. 

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Accountability and Results Focused: 
•	Conduct 1:1 meetings with clients assessing needs through interview, observation, and examination of information.
•	Create individualized plans to ensure that each client has a clear path to achieving their education and employment goals while maintaining their DTA benefits.
•	Assist clients in goal setting and identifying services leading to education, job training, skills upgrades and employment.
•	Connect with clients regularly to support successful implementation of their plan and provide monthly reporting on their behalf to DTA.
•	Understand and apply knowledge of internet resources for employment and training opportunities.
•	Establish, track and meet program dashboard indicators using database software. 
•	Facilitate Job Search Lab to assist individuals and groups with computer literacy, mock interviews, resume assistance, job applications, and job search strategies.






Build relationships, collaboration and teamwork:
•	Support and promote the mission and philosophy of JVS both internally and outside the agency.
•	Function as part of the JVS team to provide high quality employment services.
•	Establish relationships with key stakeholders, particularly the DTA, and work collaboratively in a structured and on-going manner.
•	Demonstrate knowledge of key principles and best practices of adult training, group facilitation and 1:1 career coaching. 
•	Interact in a team environment to establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with key stakeholders (participants, colleagues, coworkers, employers, partner organizations, funders, etc.) 
•	Take proactive actions to serve and refer clients to other JVS programs and opportunities.
•	Attend and actively participate in staff meetings and team-based projects.
•	Provide assistance to fellow team members when needed.

Administrative/Communication:
•	Contact potential/current clients to schedule/confirm appointments using appropriate systems and software. 
•	As a public facing team member, demonstrate a professional demeanor with strong customer service skills.  
•	Communicate effectively verbally and in writing with compassion and professionalism.
•	Exercise discretion in handling confidential information.
•	Participate in meetings, in-service trainings, team-based projects, and committees.
•	Communicate regularly with Supervisor to insure smooth delivery of services.
•	Perform other duties as assigned or requested.

MINIMIUM QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:    
•	1-3 years of experience in the  mentoring/advising/career coaching/recruiting field with excellent knowledge of career coaching tools and strategies. 
•	Knowledge of web-based job search resources and techniques.
•	Exceptional level of computer/technology proficiency including ability to complete on-line job applications and maintain accurate records of services provided in databases.
•	Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills required.
•	Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment required.
•	Bilingual or second language fluency a plus.

EDUCATION REQUIRED:  Associates in related area (Counseling, Human Resources, Psychology, Social Work, or Education) or at least 4 years’ experience.

Organizational Overview

Founded in 2003 to provide a free, public, high-quality college preparatory education for the students of East Boston and Chelsea, Excel is proving that children’s ability to succeed in high school, college, and beyond is not determined by zip code. We have grown from one school serving approximately 200 students to a network of four schools serving more than 1,300 students, and our purpose and theory of change remains consistent: we believe that when a student has the support and tools to pursue a productive post-secondary pathway aligned with personal identity and values, it can fundamentally change his/her life trajectory. As a true public school, Excel is defined not by whom we exclude but by whom we include in our community. We are proud of the fact that we serve many students with special needs.

After 8 years of operating a small single-site middle school in East Boston, Excel was designated a “Proven Provider” by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and granted two additional charters to serve middle school students. After four more successful years, Excel Academy Charter High School opened in 2015. In spring 2019, we are excited to cheer on our first senior class as they become the first cohort to receive high school diplomas from Excel.

About the Role

The Student Culture Fellow builds a positive, academics-focused culture of success among the student body at Excel Academy – Chelsea through leadership of student culture programs and support for the Dean of Students’ office. The Student Culture Fellow additionally serves as a substitute teacher, ensuring a high standard of instruction even when teachers are absent. This position reports to the Dean of Students. Specific responsibilities include:

Duties and Responsibilities

Manage Student Culture Programs

The Student Culture Fellow will manage the following programs to build student culture. Responsibilities will include tracking data, purchasing prizes, organizing materials, managing a budget, and all other duties to operate these programs successfully.

-PREP Bands (presented quarterly to all students based on PREP average)
-PREP blocks and related competitions/prizes
-PREP store once a month during Focus
-Provide logistical support to the Deans of Students during PREP Auctions preparation
-Support the Dean of Students’ Office

The Student Culture Fellow will support the Deans of Students in upholding student discipline in the school via the following duties. The Student Culture Fellow will spend between 50% of class periods weekly on-duty in the Dean of Students’ office to manage these responsibilities.

-Support morning entry and uniform-check procedures
-Manage intake of referred students and support students to complete referral reflections
-Process referrals for emergency bathroom, engagement, or professionalism for grades 5, 6, 7 and 8.
-Support students in re-entering class after referrals as needed.
-Directly communicate with parents when non-suspension consequences are issued, such as automatic detentions or referrals with a check-in.
-As needed, provide 1:1 or small-group behavior and academic support to high-need students in class following re-entry from referrals
-Provide logistical and materials-management support, including stocking paperwork in the Dean of Students’ office and creating weekly Friday Extension folders
-Manage tracking of Dean’s Office data, including Friday Extension frequency and referrals
-Input Dean’s Office data into our management system, Dean’s List
-Provide logistical support to the Dean of Students in gathering data used for Grade Level Teams (merit, demerits, etc.) and School Administration (attendance, grades)

Teaching and After-School Program Responsibilities:

The Student Culture Fellow will ensure a high quality of instruction in classes, during homeroom, and during after-school programming via the following duties:

-Serve as a substitute teacher during the school day
-Lead an Enrichment class each trimester
-Lead a Yearbook extracurricular
-Serve as a homeroom teacher and advisor
-Support the Head of School and Deans of Students as an assistant teacher for 5th Life Skills, 6th grade Leadership, and 8th grade Public Speaking elective courses
-Monitor Focus study hall to support students to complete quality homework
-Monitor students in consequences (detention)

Serve as a productive member of the Excel Community

-Uphold Excel Staff norms
-Provide coverage when needed
-Meaningfully participate in Friday meetings, school PD and family conferences
-Do whatever it takes to make sure mission of the school is fulfilled

Qualifications

-A Bachelor’s degree is required;
-Some experience working in an urban public or charter school and/or with urban students preferred; 
-The ability to speak Spanish preferred but not required;
-An unwavering commitment to and belief in the mission of Excel Academy Charter Schools, including Excel’s values and educational model;
-A commitment to addressing educational inequity;
-The ability to focus and thrive in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment;
-The ability to work effectively in a team environment and the willingness and desire to support others in doing their best work; and
-An entrepreneurial spirit that reflects an openness to change, a willingness to problem-solve, and an interest in developing new ideas & programs.


How To Apply

Please visit http://www.excelacademy.org/join-our-team/ to learn more about working at Excel, and/or visit http://jobs.jobvite.com/excel to view a current list of career opportunities and submit an application. Applications will be reviewed as they are received; candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.

Excel Academy Charter Schools do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, creed, sex, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, age, ancestry, athletic performance, special need, proficiency in the English language or a foreign language or prior academic achievement.

Teen Living/Parenting Program Family Advocate:
The advocates are an integral part of the client's treatment/support team who insure that services are coordinated and delivered to resident families in a comprehensive manner. All staff must be well versed in understanding, creating and maintaining a trauma-informed culture and be amenable to function as an active support in the daily care of the clients and their environment. Employees will be required to understand and work with behavioral and emotional deficits. Employees must provide a safe and structured environment while understanding how and when to intervene and TEACH new, healthier coping responses to stress and anxiety.

Seventy five percent of the TLP position includes documentation of meetings, goals, assessments, plans, intakes and any other necessary information. Each TLP employee will directly manage a case load of not more than four resident families. The TLP employee will also be responsible, either as part of the team or while alone on shift, for the safety of all residents and the facility, with requirements of reporting concerns to the necessary parties.

Essential Job Functions: 
-Demonstrated understanding and ability to respond to crisis situations using the model of Trauma Informed Care, Behavior Management and/or Collaborative Proactive Solutions. 
-Completing all required documentation including but not limited to: intake assessment, Bio Psycho Social, Ebed, weekly meetings, goals, progress notes, treatment plans, referrals and any concerns being addressed. 
-Implement individualized treatment plans based on specific needs or goals of each client utilizing community and other available resources. 
-Document all shift related reports, communication logs (filemaker), globe with details of shift related incidents or occurrences. Ensure passing on shift and client related information to the next shift. 
-Responsible for the safety and security of the teens, children and the facility at all times, by providing structured activities & curriculum based groups. 

Overnight specific shift requirements:
-Responsible for hourly rounds/bed checks on all residents throughout the night, insuring safe sleeping and program safety.
-Ensure hourly rounds and client status is documented.
-Clean/stock the facility and common areas.
-Provide morning transportation to youth as needed.
-Remaining awake during the entire shift is required. The appearance of sleeping is not permitted ( ie lying down, eyes closed)

COMPETENCIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:
High School Diploma required and previous experience working with youth or others in a residential setting. A bachelor's degree or some college is preferred. This position requires strong communication and organization skills. Required to pass initial competency evaluation as well as continued assessments of professional development and future trainings. Employees must have a valid driver's license with an acceptable driving record and be willing to use their personal vehicle when Centerboard's vehicles are not available to meet client transportation demands of care or outreach. Individuals are required to connect with youth with healthy relationships and positive interactions.

The Key Program is currently seeking Overnight Awake Shiftworkers for its residential group home located in Methuen that serves up to twelve teenage boys who are involved with the Massachusetts Department of Children & Families (DCF).

A $1,000 hiring bonus to be paid upon the successful completion of six months of service.
Responsibilities: Throughout the night time hours (11:00 p.m. - 8:00 a.m.) the Overnight Awake Shiftworkers work in teams of two.

ALL SHIFTWORKERS MUST REMAIN AWAKE AND ALERT AT ALL TIMES
Monitor the boys' safety in accordance with program procedures and rules
Conduct proper monitoring (eyes-on) and routine checks to insure safety and well-being of high-risk male clients
Develop a positive rapport with the boys, program staff; social workers; and police
Provide behavior management and crisis intervention to the teen boys when they need support
Assist the boys in their morning routine to include meal preparation, hygiene and transportation to school 
Serve as a positive role model to the young men following Key's guidelines regarding professional behavior
Maintain written client records in accordance with agency policies and state regulations
Qualifications:

Key’s Overnight Awake Shift Worker is an hourly paid position. A high school diploma or GED is required.  Some human service-related experience is preferred.  All candidates must be 21 years of age or older; have a valid state driver's license; and, have a legally registered and insured car for work use. All candidates must have the ability to work an overnight shift (11pm to 8am) including weekends and holidays and remain AWAKE at all times.

Compensation: The hourly wage is $15.00 with a comprehensive benefit package

Benefits Include: Health, dental and optical insurance, paid vacation and holidays; paid sick and personal time; training and supervision, tuition reimbursement, wellness benefit, pre-tax childcare, and much more.

The Key Program is a private, non-profit human services agency whose mission is to assist at-risk and court-involved children/adolescents and their families to develop positive life skills so they may pursue productive and rewarding lives. Key works in conjunction with the MA Department of Children & Families (DCF), MA Department of Youth Services (DYS), the MA Department of Mental Health (DMH) and the RI Department of Children, Youth & Families (DCYF) and is an agency provider of both community-based outreach services and residential treatment programming.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race or color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, age, country of ancestral origin, or veteran status.

The ACCS LPHA Clinician promotes the full integration and functioning of adults with psychiatric conditions by way of providing comprehensive clinical community services. Working in a community based setting, the ACCS LPHA Clinician will perform clinical duties including intake, assessment, treatment planning and clinical interventions for assigned Persons Served (PS), whether living independently in the community or in a Group Living Environment or Supported Independent Environment.


The ACCS LPHA Clinician will be responsible for determining PS needs for rehabilitative services as required by Medicaid Rehab Option for outreach and Group Home Living or Supported Independent Environments. This role will also provide leadership amongst the team by directing the delivery of Treatment Plan interventions by Team Outreach Workers, oversee treatment interventions of Persons Served in GLEs/SIEs and model appropriate interventions. The ACCS LPHA will train and supports staff in delivering clinical evidence-based practices and best practices to all Persons Served, including Group Living Environment/Supported Independent Environments (GLE/SIE) Program Directors and staff.

Requirements

Master's degree required in Social Work, Psychology, Counseling Psychology or other LCSW or LMHC or other LPHA licensure eligible program. 
LCSW, LICSW, LMHC, LRC, LADC 1, OTR, RN or Licensed Psychologist (in a mental health related discipline) valid in Massachusetts required. 
Pathways to Licensure Application Program: In lieu of licensure you could qualify for this position if you are working towards professional licensure to become a LCSW, LICSW, LMHC, LRC, LADC 1, OTR, RN or Licensed Psychologist in Massachusetts and meet the following requirements:  
◾Completed all educational requirements for licensure and/or certification.
◾Plan to achieve licensure and/or certification within 12 months.
◾Complete employer (Vinfen) sponsored Pathways to Licensure application aprroved by DMH (completed at time of hire).
◾LMHC and LRC applicants must have completed the equivalent of one full-time year of supervised clinical experience.
Clinical experience working with people with psychiatric disability and/or co-occurring disorders preferred.
Preference given to bilingual/bicultural applicants and applicants with lived experience of psychiatric conditions. 
Must have access to an operational and insured vehicle and be willing to use it to transport Person Served.

All applicants must:

✓Must be a least 21 years of age and have held a valid US driver's license for at least one year and should be able to pass a CORI, driving record, employment reference check as well as a multi-state background check.
✓Must be able to become CPR and First Aid certified within two weeks of hire and become MAP certified within 150 days of hire.

SCHEDULE:  24 hours, Tuesday - Thursday, 10:00 a.m. - 6:30 p.m.



JOB DESCRIPTION:  

Congregate Housing provides comprehensive, intensive case management support to homeless and chronically homeless individuals in housing using the Housing First Model promoting long-term stability in housing and the end of homelessness in Boston. 

The Congregate Housing Case Manager works as part of an intensive case management team serving tenants who may be experiencing untreated mental illness, active drug and alcohol addiction, and other major health challenges. The Case Manager uses a Harm Reduction, Trauma Informed approach to working with participants, including the utilization of Stages of Change Theory and Motivational Interviewing techniques. The Case Manager is responsible for a specific caseload of tenants, and also for collaborating with other Congregate Housing staff on program-wide efforts to stabilize and promote the individual growth of all Congregate Housing tenants. Additional case management responsibilities include, but are not limited to: assisting tenants with all required program documentation; assisting tenants with obtaining benefits, health care, educational opportunities, employment opportunities, and legal aid; supporting the development of tenants’ activities of daily living skills and creating individual service plans with tenants, and maintaining all necessary documentation.. 



REQUIREMENTS:  

•High School Diploma or GED


•Strong written communication skills


•Computer Proficiency in Microsoft Office Products


•Experience working with individuals experiencing substance abuse, mental illness, trauma, homelessness and/or other complex disorders


•Strong commitment to learning and using Harm Reduction and Motivational Interviewing skills in order to promote improved behavioral health among tenants


•Knowledge of effective Crisis Intervention techniques and ability to respond appropriately in crisis situations


•Experience working as part of a team


•Ability to access different building locations and program sites via vehicle, public transit, and by foot in varied weather conditions, including climbing several flights of stairs and lifting up to 50 pounds of weight 


•Ability to sit for long periods of time and use computer, calculator, fax, copier and other office equipment

Job Description

Step by Step Supportive Services (SBS) is a not-for-profit, family-supported organization that empowers individuals to find their own paths to independence while dealing with the complications of life with mental illness. SBS is an intimate organization comprised of friends, family and passionate and caring professionals who value the importance of family involvement in the recovery process and go to great lengths to foster a safe, supportive environment. Our goal is to help each person achieve self-awareness and independence through our support in either our residential setting or in their own apartment elsewhere in the community. We are seeking a clinical case manager to work either Sunday through Thursday 12 pm-8 pm OR Tuesday through Saturday 12pm-8pm shifts, with some flexibility around hours. It is incumbent upon the clinical case manager to provide direct clinical support to our clients while also facilitating community programming in our milieu.

Responsibilities

SBS individualizes our services to cater to each of our client’s preferences, goals, and needs, including the frequency and intensity of meetings as well as their location. We view our clients as partners in the treatment process, working alongside their case manager to incrementally work towards healing and change. Responsibilities include:

Provide case management tasks which include but are not limited to:
Support clients with symptom management
Provide support with executive functioning skills
Life skills coaching
Financial management, creating and implementing an individualized budget
Assist clients in developing structure through productive activity- clients should maintain 20 hours a week. Assist clients in finding appropriate volunteer or job opportunities
Weekly meal planning and rotation of groceries
Support clients with overall wellness goals.
Assist clients in time management including maintaining their own schedule of appointments, classes, work, etc.
General apartment organization and maintenance
Advocate for client in obtaining and maintaining additional outside benefits
Coordination of Services as needed with client’s treatment team.
Develop and review Individual Support Plans for assigned clients.
Complete documentation of services provided by end of every shift.
Provide intensive support and advocacy as needed.
Provide direct and indirect support to SBS clients in milieu including crisis management.
Participate in weekly staff meetings, weekly individual supervision, and additional trainings as needed.
Coordinate and facilitate evening community meals in the SBS Dinner Program and facilitate conversation
Provide transportation for clients as needed to medical or other appointments, classes, gym etc.
Remain available and accessible during designated on-call rotation weeks.
Plan, facilitate and lead therapeutic, psychoeducational and skill building groups on a quarterly basis.
Create and maintain a safe and supportive atmosphere by following program policies, and procedures.
Ensure effective communication of priority information to all necessary staff and shifts.
Respond appropriately to emergencies including contacting appropriate staff and supervisor(s), interacting with police, fire, and medical personnel as needed.
Transportation of clients to and from appointments and activities as needed.
Respond to all emails and phone calls within 24 hours.
Ensure the health, safety, and well-being for each client.
Other tasks and assignments that support the mission of Step By Step.
Qualifications

Master’s Degree in relevant human services field
Professional licensure or ability to apply for licensure within 90 days of hire, i.e. LCSW/ LICSW or LMHC
At least one year of relevant clinical experience.
Computer literate.
Ability to consistently meet all necessary background and credentialing requirements.
Valid driver’s license. Must have reliable transportation to and from work- do not need to own a care.
Salary will be based on licensure and experience. Please send a resume and cover letter to this posting if interested in the position.

mental health: 1 year (Required)

As an ACCS Residential Counselor, you will provide direct support to people with psychiatric conditions in a residential Group Living Environment designed to foster independence. In your role you will work together with the people we serve, their families, friends, employers, and other support staff to transform their lives by either building independence skills or increasing each person's quality of life.

In this role you will have a range of duties include administrating medication under the Medication Administration Plan (MAP) and assisting people with activities of daily living, such as household chores and cooking. You will also work alongside the Clinical Program Director to implement treatment plans which are recovery-oriented, person-centered, harm-reduction, trauma-informed, culturally competent and strengths-based approaches.


Requirements

A high school diploma or equivalent is required. Associate's degree in a human service discipline preferred.
Prior experience working in a human services setting strongly preferred
Preference given to bilingual/bicultural applicants and applicants with lived experience of psychiatric conditions. 
Strong time management and writing skills.

All applicants must:

✓Must be a least 21 years of age and have held a valid US driver's license for at least one year and should be able to pass a CORI, driving record, employment reference check as well as a multi-state background check. 
✓Be willing to transport clients.
✓Must be able to become CPR and First Aid certified within two weeks of hire and become MAP certified within 150 days of hire.

Springwell is seeking a social worker or case manager with elder services experience who would welcome the opportunity to broaden his/her skill set by being part of our new initiatives with health providers. This exciting position includes resource coordination and health promotion for patients of all ages.
This position works out of our Quincy office. 
POSITION DESCRIPTION
Our growing Health Partnerships Department is seeking an experienced professional for community resource coordination and outreach to medically and/or socially complex patients of all ages. This position will provide support to the patients of an established health care partner and will be embedded on-site at a medical practice. The Community Resource Specialist will work primarily telephonically but will also meet with patients face to face at the practice. The Community Resource Specialist provides a key component of holistic medical practice at this exciting time of health care reform and medical/community-based partnerships.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree required. 
Previous experience working in elder services is preferred but not required.
At least 2 years' experience in Case Management required.
GENEROUS BENEFITS
3 weeks of vacation in first year
Birthday off
11 paid holidays
2 paid floating holidays
15 paid sick days per year (You can accumulate up to 450 hours)
Health & dental insurance with employer contribution
Life and long-term disability insurance at no cost to employee
Flexible Spending Plan
Employee Assistance Plan
401K Retirement Savings Plan w/ employer contribution
Mileage reimbursement
Flexible Work Options available after 6 months; alternate start time between 8:00 and 9:30 a.m., 4 day work week, 4.5 day work week, telecommuting work option, remote work option
Employee referral bonuses
Free parking 
Commitment to promoting from within
COMPANY PROFILE
At Springwell, we are serious about our mission. For more than 40 years, our staff has worked to help ensure that seniors and individuals with disabilities have the village they need and the support that is necessary for them to live at home with dignity and independence.
We are also serious about our employees. We are focused on creating a supportive, and welcoming environment that values each and every member of our staff. At Springwell we are fiercely committed to creating equal opportunities for all regardless of race, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, gender expression, national origin, age, language, and physical or mental disabilities. 
We believe in:
Accountability: At every level of the organization we are accountable: to the people we serve, to our funders, to our employees, to community professionals who rely on our support.
Continuous Quality Improvement: We honor the fact that each of us is human, and we embrace a desire to examine the value and quality of our work and ask how we can provide a higher quality of service.
Transparency: While we don't claim to be 100% transparent (there are certain things, like salaries and performance evaluations that are private) we continuously strive to be as open as possible.
Balance: Life is a give and take, as is work. We are always examining that balance. Today, we have yoga classes on-site twice a week. We are exploring offering a Weight Watchers meeting. And afternoon meditation is under consideration. If there is a holiday to celebrate we have a party. This year, we built a dedicated lactation room for new moms. We are committed to listening to our staff, and examining and re-balancing our work environment.

Church Parish Administrator (Part Time) (Arlington, MA) 
St. Paul Lutheran Church

Job Description: Parish Administrator

General Summary and Overview
The Church Administrative Assistant will be responsible for performing and coordinating a wide range of duties addressing the administrative, communications, event planning and other key activities of the Church. 

Principal Duties and Responsibilities
General
•	Create professional and polished formatted documents, e-mail announcements, newsletters, website updates and other correspondence
•	Provide administrative support to the Pastor, Intern, Staff, Church Council, and Committees
•	Greet, assist and direct the members and visitors who call or come into the office
•	Act as the key liaison for communication and scheduling among the three congregations sharing the church building
•	Attend staff meetings and staff retreats

Office Operations and Communications
•	Manage the day to day operations and communications of the church office
•	Plan and schedule meetings and appointments
•	Create and coordinate the publication of weekly church service bulletins, weekly online newsletter, e-mail messages, and other communications as required
•	Organize and maintain paper and electronic files
•	Maintain, publish and manage church calendar
•	Disseminate information by using the telephone, mail, website and e-mail
•	Maintain and update the membership database and weekly attendance report
•	Process new member information, including writing for transfers
•	Compile Committee reports and prepare the congregation's Annual Report
•	Compile/enter data to produce Synod Parochial Report
•	Assist the pastor with wedding and funeral scheduling, including initial inquiries and visits
•	Support the annual stewardship mailing campaign

Building Usage
•	Schedule and manage building usage among the 3 congregations that worship at St. Paul, as well as community groups that rent out space
•	Work with the Church Property Manager on room set-up for meetings and events
•	Schedule all weddings and funerals in coordination with the pastor and intern
•	Assign and collect church keys; maintain key assignment list
 

Basic Qualifications
•	High School Diploma or equivalent
•	Minimum of 1-3 years of administrative or office support required.

Additional Qualifications
•	Proven communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact respectfully and effectively with the Pastor and other Staff, members, volunteers, children/youth and guests.
•	Self-starter with the ability to work independently as well as cooperatively in a team environment with a positive attitude.
•	Excellent computer and office equipment skills to include word processing and graphic design/layout skills. Candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office (including Publisher) and have the ability to come up to speed quickly with the church database management software and other software (including social media) as required in the church office environment. Website update/maintenance experience a plus.
•	Strong written communication skills, including writing, editing, formatting and proofreading.
•	Excellent attention to detail. 
•	Ability to plan, prioritize and multi-task.
•	Discretion, good judgment and the ability to maintain confidentiality.
•	Ability to coordinate and delegate assignments.
•	Professional appearance and demeanor.
•	Flexibility and a sense of humor.


Supervisory Responsibility
•	None

Supervision
Reports to Pastor and Church Business Administrator

Working Conditions
•	20-25 hours per week. Exact hours and schedule to be mutually agreed upon, but preferably Monday-Friday 9:00-1:00 or 9:00-2:00
•	Designated office space within the Church
•	Compensation is $20.00 per hour

Physical Requirements of the Job
•	Ability to perform standard office functions




Please visit our website at www.stpaularlington.org to learn more about our vibrant congregation.

Do you see the potential in young people? Are you passionate about building community? Are you looking to further your education and career? Serve as an AmeriCorps Massachusetts Promise Fellow, where passion meets opportunity!

Support young people throughout the Commonwealth in out-of-school time programs, join a team of committed corps members passionate about creating social change, and further your education through the opportunity to pursue free coursework at Northeastern University! Find out more about the Fellowship by visiting www.masspromisefellows.org and clicking on 'Apply'!

Fellows are emerging leaders that spend a year of their lives delivering the resources that young people need to be successful in life by providing out-of-school-time opportunities for youth in grades 6-12 focused on college and career exploration and academic enrichment. During a year of AmeriCorps service, Fellows serve full-time for eleven months with non-profit organizations, schools, and state and local agencies throughout the Commonwealth. Fellows engage in monthly teambuilding and training activities as a cohort. Trainings are focused on youth development, social justice and identity, and supporting youth in out-of-school time settings. Since 1999, over 500 Fellows have mobilized community activity in a variety of ways, including:

-Designing and leading out-of-school time programs focused on academic enrichment

-Delivering college and career exploration curricula for young people

-Creating meaningful relationships with youth

-Recruiting and managing volunteers

Qualifications:

-Experience working with young people

-Excellent organizational and communication skills 

-The ability to work independently and as part of a team

-Passionate about social justice and working with diverse communities

-An interest in and commitment to national and community service 

-Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously

-Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills

-Professional and mature

-17 years of age or older

-Must be a US Citizen, US National or Permanent Resident Alien

-Must be willing to comply with a criminal background check and FBI fingerprint check

How to apply:

Fellows are hired on a rolling basis each spring. Visit www.masspromisefellows.org to view all position descriptions and click here to apply. All positions will be accepting applications until filled.

Benefits:

For an eleven month full-time commitment and 1,700 hours of AmeriCorps service Fellows receive:

A taxable living allowance of up to $15,500 • Excellent training opportunities • FREE courses at Northeastern University in the College of Professional Studies & discounted courses upon successfully completing the service year • Loan forbearance and up to $6,095 educational award • Monthly travel allowance •Career coaching and support • Healthcare Reimbursement

Start Date: August 5th, 2019

End Date: June 30th, 2020

The Massachusetts Promise Fellowship is committed to providing equal opportunities. We serve and partner with diverse organizations, and are dedicated to non-discrimination. It is our policy to ensure that all individuals with whom we are in contact are treated equally without regard to age, color, disability, gender, marital status, national origin, religion, sexual orientation or expression, or veteran status. We require that all our partners make reasonable accommodations for interviews and service for any and all individuals with a permanent or temporary disability. We actively partner with organizations representing minority concerns and interests to build high-performing teams that mirror the communities we serve.

Lynn, MA - Teen Living/Parenting Program Family Advocate Opportunity

Full-Time and Part-Time Opportunities Available - Weekend, Evening and/or Overnight (Female Candidates)

Teen Living/Parenting Program Family Advocate:
The advocates are an integral part of the client's treatment/support team who insure that services are coordinated and delivered to resident families in a comprehensive manner. All staff must be well versed in understanding, creating and maintaining a trauma-informed culture and be amenable to function as an active support in the daily care of the clients and their environment. Employees will be required to understand and work with behavioral and emotional deficits. Employees must provide a safe and structured environment while understanding how and when to intervene and TEACH new, healthier coping responses to stress and anxiety.

Seventy five percent of the TLP position includes documentation of meetings, goals, assessments, plans, intakes and any other necessary information. Each TLP employee will directly manage a case load of not more than four resident families. The TLP employee will also be responsible, either as part of the team or while alone on shift, for the safety of all residents and the facility, with requirements of reporting concerns to the necessary parties.

Essential Job Functions: 
-Demonstrated understanding and ability to respond to crisis situations using the model of Trauma Informed Care, Behavior Management and/or Collaborative Proactive Solutions. 
-Completing all required documentation including but not limited to: intake assessment, Bio Psycho Social, Ebed, weekly meetings, goals, progress notes, treatment plans, referrals and any concerns being addressed. 
-Implement individualized treatment plans based on specific needs or goals of each client utilizing community and other available resources. 
-Document all shift related reports, communication logs (filemaker), globe with details of shift related incidents or occurrences. Ensure passing on shift and client related information to the next shift. 
-Responsible for the safety and security of the teens, children and the facility at all times, by providing structured activities & curriculum based groups. 

Overnight specific shift requirements:
-Responsible for hourly rounds/bed checks on all residents throughout the night, insuring safe sleeping and program safety.
-Ensure hourly rounds and client status is documented.
-Clean/stock the facility and common areas.
-Provide morning transportation to youth as needed.
-Remaining awake during the entire shift is required. The appearance of sleeping is not permitted ( ie lying down, eyes closed)

COMPETENCIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:
High School Diploma required and previous experience working with youth or others in a residential setting. A bachelor's degree or some college is preferred. This position requires strong communication and organization skills. Required to pass initial competency evaluation as well as continued assessments of professional development and future trainings. Employees must have a valid driver's license with an acceptable driving record and be willing to use their personal vehicle when Centerboard's vehicles are not available to meet client transportation demands of care or outreach. Individuals are required to connect with youth with healthy relationships and positive interactions.

Centerboard offers competitive salary, great benefits, flexible schedules and a fun working environment.
Bilingual (Spanish/Portuguese) applicants are encouraged to apply.

Interested and qualified applicants should apply through our website online application process by using the link below. 

https://workforcenow.adp.com/jobs/apply/posting.html?client=cboard#

To learn more about Centerboard, please visit www.centerboard.org

Job Title: Houseparents
Apply Here: https://jobs.boystown.org/category/houseparent-jobs/197/14281/1

Job Summary:

In a career as Houseparents (also referred to as Family-Teaching Partners), part of giving youth a second chance is exposing them to new experiences. Youth come to the Boys Town Family Home Program for a variety of reasons – family issues, abuse, neglect, abandonment, involvement in the juvenile justice system. You come in by presenting them with opportunities in education and school involvement, giving them their first happy Thanksgiving or teaching them how faith can help them heal. We strive to give Boys Town Kids the fulfilling lives they deserve. 

This position can be considered for any of our locations in Washington D.C, Rhode Island, Nebraska, North Florida, Central Florida or Louisiana. **We currently have immediate needs in Nebraska, Florida and Rhode Island.

Responsibilities: 

•	Live on-site in a Boys Town Family Home and provide direct care for 6-8 at-risk youth through creating a safe and loving family-style living environment
•	Provide emotional support utilizing praise, positive feedback, affection and empathy to build ones self-confidence and respect
•	Use rational problem solving techniques to teach youth critical thinking skills, assist with behavioral problems, counsel through personal issues and provide crisis intervention
•	Plan, participate and provide opportunities for individual and family activities that are both educational and entertaining
•	Display and teach parenting, family and relationship skills to youth, legal guardians and caretakers to create family engagement
•	Maintain contact with both internal and external consumers agencies to obtain or provide information regarding youth’s behaviors, strategies and progress
•	Prepare written records for household budgeting, tracking youth progress, reporting incidents/behaviors and document youth medical needs and appointments
•	Teach and role model Boys Town values and ethical behaviors, as well as support and encourage participation in regular religious activities
•	Supervise the activities of assigned Assistant Family-Teacher to aid in their development and success
•	Manage the daily operating schedule of the home; assist with youth transportation needs, and overall household upkeep

Benefits & Perks:

•	Annual starting salary of $68,000 per couple (Dependent upon location)
•	Fully-paid living expenses, which include rent, utilities, and a monthly household budget 
•	Benefits package that includes health, dental and vision insurance; a 401K retirement plan; paid vacation and sick leave
•	Supporting youth with new traditions such as sport events, family dinner, graduation or volunteering in the community
•	Opportunities to earn college credit while working
•	Relocation assistance 
•	Company vehicle

Required Qualifications:

•	Be at least 21 years of age or older
•	High School diploma or equivalent is required, some college credit is preferred
•	Must possess a valid marriage certificate
•	Valid driver’s license with good driving record and ability to pass MVR Check
•	Flexibility and willingness to work a wide array of hours, which includes days, evenings, weekends and holidays
•	Ability to pass a thorough background check and reference verification procedure in order to determine one’s fitness to satisfactorily and safely care for youth
•	Ability to attend a 2-weeks paid training in Omaha, Nebraska

About the Village of Boys Town: 

A National Historic Landmark since 1985, the Village of Boys Town is now the only National Historic Landmark District in Nebraska. At any given time, about 400 boys and girls live in the Village, receiving care and guidance for a wide range of behavioral, emotional and academic issues. When Father Edward J. Flanagan purchased the Overlook Farm in 1921, it became the new, permanent site of Boys Town. Over the decades that followed, schools, churches and homes were built, and tens of thousands of young lives were transformed. 

Our employees are our #1 supporters when it comes to achieving Boys Town's mission, which is why we offer an array of competitive and attractive benefit options. Unique perks to Boys Town employees and their families include free visits to Boys Town Physicians, free prescriptions, tuition assistance, access to the campus Field House, parenting resources from our experts and advancement opportunities within the organization, just to name a few. Working at Boys Town is more than just a job, it is a way of life.

About Boys Town:

Boys Town touches the lives of more than 2 million children and families nationwide each year. As one of the country’s largest nonprofit funded child-care organizations, Boys Town is nationally recognized for its research-proven child, health and family care programs. From our start in 1917, we’re poised to make even greater strides forward as we lead the way in changing how America cares for children, families and communities for the next 100 years.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. Wizards & Warriors Camp is a creative STEM-based summer camp run by professionals, parents, and teachers who wanted to create the experience of a live adventure as a way to help kids and teens discover the hero they hold inside.

Are you / Do you:

Love working with kids?
Have a fascination with the fantasy genre?
Have a very active imagination?
A responsible and good role model?
Don’t mind being hit with foam weapons?
Like to dress in costume and wear cool makeup?
Consider safety BEFORE anything else – no matter how fun?
If you responded “yes” to each of the above, then you should consider applying to staff at our camp!

Our camp counselors receive one of the highest pay rates in the industry. We provide training, costumes (although you can bring your own!), props, makeup, and foam weapons.

In return, our expectations are high. We require you to be responsible, flexible, and reliable. You must fully embrace and adhere to the concept that this camp is for the campers, which means that all of our staff are having the most amount of fun when our campers are having tons of fun. As such, the roles you play and the positions you hold are always in service of the entertainment value. We all have favorite characters we enjoy playing, but what is more important is if the campers like the characters (or at least like fighting them).

We only invite back staff who meet our high level of performance. It is an exhausting, demanding job that requires both physical and mental endurance. But you will have the time of your life and we can guarantee that you will never be bored!

All camp staff are required to have previous experience working with kids and teens and be at least 18 years of age. Acting experience is not necessary but does help. We’re interested in mature decision makers – counselors and performers who like to take part in a creative, improvisational environment – but always with safety foremost in their mind. You must be exceptionally reliable and a good communicator. Punctuality is necessary as the nature of these activities requires precision timing. Professionalism is mandatory.

Please note that Wizards & Warriors Camp is owned and run by parents. Our own children attend these camps. Safety is our highest concern. We expect that it will be yours as well.

References required.  Must be available: Sunday, June 23 – Wednesday, August 14 for overnight/day camp in Salem 

Salem Summer Camp Overnight Counselor positions pay is depending on experience and schedule for 7 weeks plus room and board (includes paid training).  This is an overnight position with onsite residency required.

Salem Summer Camp Quest-Day Counselor positions pay is depending on experience and schedule for 7 weeks plus lunch (includes paid training).  Residency not required.  Transportation provided from bus stops.

Summer Quest Camp hours are 8am-4pm (or as early as 7am and as late as 6pm) for up to 7 weeks and counselors do not reside at the camp.

Residential/Overnight Summer Camp is up to 7.5 weeks with one or two days off each week and counselors are required to reside at the camp (except for their day off).

All staff, performers, and volunteers must submit to a CORI and SORI Background Check, intensive screening, and reference check.

The best candidates are…

Age 20 and over with experience working with kids of various ages.  Teachers and childcare professionals are strongly encouraged to apply.
People who love teaching in a positive learning environment and who have afternoons or weekends available.
Residential/Overnight and Day Camp Counselors who have background in theater or acting.
Coaches, Teachers, Instructors, or Group Leaders who are passionate about working with kids, but may not have experience in our particular activities.
No experience in swordsmanship is necessary. We will train you!

Camp Counselor roles include:

Weapons Master
Guildmaster Librarian
Monster Chief
Ranger
Healer Guildmaster

To apply, please go to: https://www.swordsummercamp.com/summer_camp_counselor/

In collaboration with the psychiatric care provider and other PACT nurses, the PACT Nurse – Per Diem assists in the management PACT’s medication system, provides direct service to Persons Served, and they have an outpatient medical appointment.Prepare, distribute, collect, review, and upload health communication forms to relay and receive information from outpatient health providers and receive, review, and upload discharge summaries from inpatient providers.Engage in health promotion, prevention and education activities, such as assessing for risky behaviors (e.g., unsafe sex) and carrying out interventions intended to influence behavior change, assessing and intervening on health/medical risk factors or conditions (e.g., providing education and monitoring of diets specific to diabetic needs or to prevent and address obesity, hypertension and high cholesterol), tracking all age-related and family history health screens (e.g., a colonoscopy at age 50, prostate exam for men at age 50 or earlier if African-American or a family history; a mammogram for women at age 40), engaging in strategies to reduce tobacco use, assessing wellness/health management skills, and collaboratively working with the team on developing a wellness management plan or strategy.Educate other PACT team members either formally (e.g., cross-training) or informally (in the daily team meeting) to help them monitor psychiatric symptoms and medication side effects and train staff on safe medication delivery practices.Assist Persons Served to develop strategies to maximize the taking of medications as prescribed (e.g., behavioral tailoring, development of individual cues and reminders) when the Persons Served is in agreement.Accompany Persons Served to medical care appointments when specialized medical input will likely be imparted that requires a more sophisticated medical interpretation.

Institute for Healthcare Improvement


The Institute for Healthcare Improvement (IHI) is an independent not-for-profit organization based in Boston, Massachusetts, USA. For more than 25 years, IHI has used improvement science to advance and sustain better outcomes in health and health systems across the world. IHI brings awareness of safety and quality to millions, catalyzes learning and the systematic improvement of care, develops solutions to previously intractable challenges, and mobilizes health systems, communities, regions, and nations to reduce harm and deaths. IHI collaborates with a growing community to spark bold, inventive ways to improve the health of individuals and populations. IHI generates optimism, harvests fresh ideas, and supports anyone, anywhere who wants to profoundly change health and health care for the better. Learn more at ihi.org.

Position Summary:

Reporting to IHI’s Director of Multimedia, the Content Director, Website and Digital Media is responsible for IHI.org (and all related web properties) and charting new paths for IHI content and media. The work involves developing both short- and long-term strategies to attract and retain IHI customers, myriad content creation and editing projects, and collaboration with all departments and teams within the organization. This position demands a creative critical thinker—a visionary—who can thrive in a fast-paced environment—someone who can excel in a high-level strategy meeting one minute, improve SEO on a popular webpage the next, and provide developmental edits on a new piece of content the next.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with IHI content experts and other multimedia content producers to continuously update and improve IHI.org and all related website properties. The candidate will rely on years of experience, knowledge of audience engagement, and exceptional editorial judgment to produce high-quality content and create clear, logical pathways for IHI customers.

This position sits on the IHI Multimedia team but will work very closely with others in the organization—including Marketing, Program Development, Content Portfolios, regions, and other functional areas—to envision and execute dissemination plans via IHI.org, the invaluable “front door” to IHI’s content and programming. The ideal candidate will have an excellent grasp of new media and technology, with strong experience in creating and designing digital and mobile content for a vast and diverse audience. The candidate will have the interest and ability to think globally and consider how IHI content appears to customers around the world. 

The ideal candidate will also be responsible for some skill-based training and teaching within the organization, and may manage and professionally develop members of the IHI Multimedia team. The candidate will occasionally present in a variety of settings, including at staff meetings and to executive team members, promoting the value of IHI content and IHI.org and highlighting their benefit to customers. 

Position Responsibilities: 

	Website:

      •	Envision and help create a dynamic website experience for customers that includes fast, easy navigation, and best-in-class look, feel, and functionality.
      •	Help determine and carry out long- and short-term strategic vision, goals, and priorities for content development in alignment with IHI’s overall strategy.
      •	Help attract new customers to IHI.org and related web properties through various means, including iterative design improvement, search improvement, and SEO.
      •	Help retain existing customers by allowing them to more easily navigate to both new and popular “evergreen” content, reinforcing IHI.org as the go-to source for quality and safety knowledge.
      •	Lead the design and implementation of a process for publishing new content on IHI.org, including identifying new content, and quality control of the harvesting, preparation, editing, and posting of material.
      •	Possess expert knowledge and skills within UI and UX, with constant curiosity and energy to work with customers to improve their experience on IHI.org.
      •	Lead improvement efforts based on data, analytics, and continuous feedback—both quantitative and qualitative—from customers. 
      •	Lead future redesign and potential re-platforming efforts that take a customer-centric view of website structure, navigation, and experience. 
      •	Promote IHI’s voice and brand to an increasingly global audience via IHI.org.
      •	Create connections with Marketing colleagues to develop strategic content to promote IHI programs. 
      •	Create connections for (and with) other departments, including portfolios, regions, and functional areas within IHI.

	Digital Media:

      •	Envision and execute new ways to display and share IHI content with an increasingly global audience.
      •	Have a “digital-first” mindset that will help the organization test new formats and dynamic visions for IHI’s trusted content and brand.
      •	Possess a creative vision that benefits new projects and products, and injects new life into existing written, visual, and other multimedia content.
      •	Lead efforts to increase IHI’s ability to reach (and delight) customers on mobile platforms.
      •	Lead a variety of projects that combine various types of media to tell compelling stories about IHI’s work.
      •	Work closely with IHI’s marketing department to envision and create engaging new ways to attract customers to IHI’s best-in-class programing.
      •	Possess strong skills in web development and digital content creation tools and have the ability/desire to learn new ones. 
      •	Help align IHI’s myriad content dissemination channels—e.g., IHI.org, blogs, social media—so they make sense to the customer. 
      •	Possess knowledge about current and emerging web and mobile technology.

Essential Position Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

      •	Expert in UX and UI
      •	Strong background in data, analytics, and measurement 
      •	Strong writing and editing skills
      • Strong analytical and project management skills
      •	Strong background in content management systems
      •	Ability to conceptualize and execute a wide range of media deliverables
      •	Strong strategic thinker and collaborator that can excel as a leader and team member
      •	Ability to work in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment
      •	Highly energetic, motivated, and resourceful
      •	Ability to juggle a variety of projects, and reliably deliver an excellent, timely product 
      •	Strong multi-tasking and time management skills
      •	Graphic design experience preferred
      •	Knowledge of some media editing software preferred
      •	Knowledge/experience in the health care field preferred

Position Qualifications:

      •	Bachelor’s degree required, advanced degree in related field preferred 
      •	Must have at least 7-10 years’ experience with websites and digital content 
      •	Be knowledgeable of IHI’s mission and have a willingness to embrace and actively support the unique culture and values of IHI and our work
      •	Personal commitment to workplace diversity, inclusion and equity

NFI Massachusetts Inc, a non-profit human services agency, is currently seeking a Residential Counselor for its STARR program CIP  as well as its North Crossing group home.

Youth referred to these programs are in need of temporary out-of-home placement to address a range of emotional and behavioral issues. The programs offer 24 hour staffing that provides support and supervision. Comprehensive clinical services include treatment planning, life skills training, individual/group/family therapy and access to social and recreational resources in the community.

The highly structured milieus provide a safe and predictable context in which youth can stabilize behaviors, progress in treatment and develop new skills. Staff members serve as teachers and coaches, developing practical supports and interventions for youth that are readily transferable to the home environment and can be easily understood and taught to families. While the programs specialize in family reunification, they also work with youth who transfer to foster care or independent living. For youth who do not have reunification as a goal, the programs focus on cultivating family involvement whenever possible and establishing meaningful lifelong connections to other caring adults who can guide them into adulthood.

We are seeking dedicated and qualified candidates with strong leadership skills to provide direct care to youth served within the program. The goal is to provide these youth support, mentoring, guidance and to demonstrate positive role modeling so they may elect healthier choices to and learn new skills to use upon their discharge from the program.

Job Requirements:

-Qualified candidates will possess a Bachelor's degree in psychology, sociology or other related field of study and/or extensive experience working with a similar population, or a combination of education and experience.
-Valid driver's license.

Beth El Temple Center (www.betheltemplecenter.org)  is looking for a Temple Administrator to join our professional staff.  This key role is responsible for smooth and efficient administrative function of the temple and supervising custodial staff. Reporting to the Rabbi and the Temple President, the Temple Administrator is a full-time benefits-eligible position. 

Beth El Temple Center is a 400 member Reform congregation, affiliated with the Union for Reform Judaism. Beth El Temple Center is located in Belmont, MA and serves many surrounding communities, including Cambridge, Watertown, Waltham, Lexington, Arlington, and Somerville.  Beth El has a strong egalitarian tradition and welcomes Jews and their families who want to be a part of our Jewish community. Beth El Temple Center offers a place for learning and living Torah, a place to help repair the world, and a place to nurture your soul.

It is important for the Temple Administrator to reflect, in both disposition and work ethic, the Jewish value of Kavod (respect for all), keep a well-run and organized institution, all while maintaining a pleasant and welcoming demeanor and a professional presentation.

More specific responsibilities include the following:

Manage the day-to-day work of the custodial staff; including supervising room set-up, daily maintenance and cleaning, procedures relating to services, outdoor landscaping/clean-up duties, and building/equipment repairs
Prepare the Temple for each Jewish Holiday and its corresponding capital needs
Liaise with and oversee the work of vendors, including IT and general building maintenance
